item.title: Cutting through the laptop installation jungle
(Errors in) Communicating statistics - Base rate neglect

item.description: Hi, I’m David I am a Berlin-based mathematician with an interest in practical data science that measurably improves people’s lives. Currently I work as a data science consultant at idalab and volunteer on the core team of Data Science for Social Good Berlin. I also work on with the people from rocs. If you would like to get in touch, contact me via mail[at]thisdomain, my PGP public key (optional!) is here.

item.title: Projects
item.description: CoVid-19 Mobility In March 2020 I supported my former team at HU Berlin / RKI, ROCS, by co-analysing the reduction of trips from German citizens following the measures to slow the pandemic spread of CoVid-19. Our analysis showed about a 40% reduction of trip numbers overall, with a stronger reduction of trips between counties than within counties. Ongoing. Mission Prescription In December 2019 I attended the hackathon #HackingAMR organised by JPIAMR in Stockholm.
